alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central New Castle, north central Kent, northwestern Cumberland and southwestern Salem Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hope Creek, or 11 miles east of Middletown, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salem, Hancocks Bridge, Woodland Beach, Newport Meadows, Hope Creek and Chambersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
